etymologies: late Middle English (also in the sense ‘squandering, waste’): from late Latin dilapidatio(n-), from Latin dilapidare ‘demolish, squander’ (see dilapidate)

definitions: the state or process of falling into decay or being in disrepair

examples.text: the mill was in a state of dilapidation

shortDefinitions: state or process of falling into decay or being in disrepair

definitions: repairs required during or at the end of a tenancy or lease.
shortDefinitions: repairs required during or at end of tenancy or lease

definitions: a cause of action to force a tenant to pay for dilapidations.
shortDefinitions: cause of action to force tenant to pay for such repairs

definitions: (in church use) a sum charged against an incumbent for wear and tear during a tenancy.
shortDefinitions: (in church use) sum charged against incumbent for wear and tear during tenancy
